# Cambridge International AS & A Level  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 171, 196, 202]]<|/det|>
CANDIDATE NAME  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 221, 171, 250]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[620, 220, 722, 250]]<|/det|>
CANDIDATE NUMBER  

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[737, 214, 907, 255]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 277, 232, 294]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[836, 278, 907, 294]]<|/det|>
9709/31  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 303, 312, 319]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Pure Mathematics 3  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[784, 303, 907, 320]]<|/det|>
May/June 2022  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 329, 907, 345]]<|/det|>
1 hour 50 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 357, 395, 373]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 384, 390, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 418, 225, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 435, 875, 632]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 664, 216, 679]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 680, 732, 712]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 75.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 777, 92]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(2(3^{2x-1}) = 4^{x+1}\), giving your answer correct to 2 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 589, 92]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(2\cot 2x + 3\cot x = 5\), for \(0^\circ < x < 180^\circ\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 542, 92]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 100, 554, 131]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} = \frac{xy}{1 + x^2},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 139, 297, 157]]<|/det|>
and \(y = 2\) when \(x = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 170, 782, 189]]<|/det|>
Solve the differential equation, obtaining a simplified expression for \(y\) in terms of \(x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 170, 920, 189]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
The polynomial \(ax^{3} - 10x^{2} + bx + 8\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants, is denoted by \(\mathrm{p}(x)\). It is given that \((x - 2)\) is a factor of both \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) and \(\mathrm{p}^{\prime}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 120, 146, 138]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 120, 373, 138]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 138]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 631, 92]]<|/det|>
When \(a\) and \(b\) have these values, factorise \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) completely.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 411, 91]]<|/det|>
Hence find the exact value of \(I\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 79, 94, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 771, 104]]<|/det|>
The complex number \(u\) is defined by \(u = \frac{\sqrt{2} - a\sqrt{2}\mathrm{i}}{1 + 2\mathrm{i}}\) , where \(a\) is a positive integer.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 115, 144, 134]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 115, 761, 134]]<|/det|>
Express \(u\) in terms of \(a\), in the form \(x + \mathrm{i}y\), where \(x\) and \(y\) are real and exact.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 115, 920, 134]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 326, 91]]<|/det|>
It is now given that \(a = 3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 106, 149, 123]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 104, 920, 125]]<|/det|>
Express \(u\) in the form \(r\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i}\theta}\), where \(r > 0\) and \(-\pi < \theta \leqslant \pi\), giving the exact values of \(r\) and \(\theta\). [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 512, 178, 530]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[181, 512, 920, 548]]<|/det|>
Using your answer to part (b), find the two square roots of \(u\). Give your answers in the form \(r\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i}\theta}\), where \(r > 0\) and \(-\pi < \theta \leqslant \pi\), giving the exact values of \(r\) and \(\theta\). [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[245, 87, 784, 327]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 350, 920, 400]]<|/det|>
In the diagram, \(OABCDEFG\) is a cuboid in which \(OA = 2\) units, \(OC = 4\) units and \(OG = 2\) units. Unit vectors \(\mathbf{i}\), \(\mathbf{j}\) and \(\mathbf{k}\) are parallel to \(OA\), \(OC\) and \(OG\) respectively. The point \(M\) is the midpoint of \(DF\). The point \(N\) on \(AB\) is such that \(AN = 3NB\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 415, 146, 433]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 413, 598, 433]]<|/det|>
Express the vectors \(\overrightarrow{OM}\) and \(\overrightarrow{MN}\) in terms of \(\mathbf{i}\), \(\mathbf{j}\) and \(\mathbf{k}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 415, 920, 433]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 689, 148, 707]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 689, 579, 707]]<|/det|>
Find a vector equation for the line through \(M\) and \(N\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 689, 920, 707]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 564, 92]]<|/det|>
Verify by calculation that \(a\) lies between 2 and 2.5.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 344, 186, 363]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 346, 920, 384]]<|/det|>
Show that if a sequence of values in the interval \(0 < x < \pi\) given by the iterative formula \(x_{n + 1} = \pi - \tan^{-1}\left(\frac{1}{2} x_n\right)\) converges, then it converges to \(a\), the root of the equation in part (a). [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 643, 144, 660]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 643, 920, 677]]<|/det|>
Use the iterative formula given in part (c) to determine \(a\) correct to 2 decimal places. Give the result of each iteration to 4 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 658, 920, 676]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 75, 568, 92]]<|/det|>
